utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Okay, boys and girls. Guess what kind of animal Wacky Benny's making now? Give you a big hint.

utterance.speaker: Red Headed Boy
utterance.content: Is it a dead animal?

utterance.speaker: Red Headed Boy
utterance.content: You're a sucky clown.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: And you're a super-duper audience.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Hey, that is not okay.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Tell him to keep his hand off me.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I can't move my arm or leg.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So how does a completely healthy teenager have a mini-stroke?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Head CT and cerebral angiogram are normal. Clotting parameters are normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're forgetting the wrinkly clump in the middle of his shirt. Thought we'd diagnose the middle-aged clown first.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's probably from my seat belt.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wrinkle pattern's too varied. It looks like someone shoved you or grabbed you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Probably from the diaper bag. If the patient's using drugs, cocaine could have caused an arterial spasm in his brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The tox screen was clean. I'm gonna say it was the ex-girlfriend you cheated on, not the ex-wife you cheated with. If the latter was prone to violence, you'd have been scattered in various dumpsters years ago.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Seriously? No one else wants to talk about the patient? New office furniture. Meaty topic.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What's the action on the ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It was Rachel's boyfriend Phil. His company's moving him back to Portland. He wants me to change my visitation order so he can ask Rachel and my daughter to move out west with him. Things got a little heated.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The patient was punched in the groin. Could have triggered a massive sympathetic discharge.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Carotid duplex is normal. Who's better qualified to be the daddy? The guy who spilled a little DNA in her gene pool or the guy who's gonna be there day and night to pass on important values like, not shtupping mommy after the divorce?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I am her daddy. She's staying here.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: House has a point. A couple nights a week with each kid may make you feel better. Doesn't replace two 'round-the-clock parents.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 'Round-the-clock or not, parenting's an impossible job. No way not to mess it up. Why shouldn't Taub be the one to do it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Makes sense. Park's tiger mom and dad were so insufferable, she has to measure their affection in hours. Chase's careerist dad and alcoholic mom were so indifferent, he has to believe it's a wash. Your turn. What did your screwed-up parents do to screw up your view of parenting?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: They were good parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's an oxymoron. Chase is right. All parents screw up all children. He's also dreamy, but it's not relevant now.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So all parents screw up all children, but it makes some huge difference if I keep my daughter here or let her move? Endocarditis. Flipped a piece of vegetation into his brain, which could have broken up before the angiogram.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Transesophageal echo to confirm. Screwed up is your best case. Bouncing between a philandering workaholic dad and an embittered, sexually betrayed mom, it's gonna lead to screwed-up squared.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: Is endocarditis treatable?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Very. The echo will show us any growths on his heart valve. Most likely meds will be enough. He won't even need surgery.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: He's just taken up performing and it's very stressful for him. Could that have caused this?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: It's not stressful. I have fun.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Stress wouldn't be relevant, but anything that increases his adrenalin could have made it worse.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: Maybe we find you a new hobby, one you're a little better at.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I'm gonna get better at it, and it's not a hobby. I-I think I want to get a job working as a circus clown, making people laugh.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: Ben, I-I don't think that's a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: It was good enough for my dad.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're a, uhâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: No, his biological father.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: Could his dad's melanoma be a factor here?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That wouldn't be related.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: Ben, you barely knew him. You're such a smart kid. You could aim a lot higher than face paint and seltzer bottles.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient Monroe
utterance.content: I need treatment for my type 2 diabetes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There is absolutely no part of that sentence that is true.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: I've been experiencing weight gain, fatigue, and sluggishness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Weight loss is a symptom of diabetes. Fatigue is a symptom of thinking you have disease you don't actually have, and sluggishness is a synonym of fatigue.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: I need Insulin. I know it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Much as I'd like to kill you by dangerously lowering your blood sugar, murder violates my parole.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: That bloodwork is week's old. Test me again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am the test. The test is negative. The test also thinks you're a giant pain in the ass. That last insult was your cue to leave.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Test me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Wait right here.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sleep study. Please make sure he's not disturbed for the next eight hours.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We need to talk about Saturday night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. Historians will talk of Saturday night, not us. The legendary night, on which we watch Santos shatter Rubio's jaw and you epically pay me $50.00.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have a chance to really watch it. A patient of mine has a pair of tickets he can't use, and obviously you're under house and office arrest. I just wanted to make sure you were cool if I go to Atlantic City without you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, no, thanks. I'm afraid I'm gonna have to decline your invitation to not spend Saturday night with you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: These are ringside seats.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameras are ringside too. If you want, I could sweat and spit and bleed on you from time to time.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'd take you if I could.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'd take me if either of us could. See what a tough spot I'm in?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm going to that fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All right, I'll take the other ticket. Let me worry about logistics.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient's heart valves are normal. It's not endocarditis. But he has a thickened pericardium, which makes no sense.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He has a heart problem but not one that could have caused his T.I.A.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Syphilitic vasculitis would explain the T.I.A., and the pericardial inflammation.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Syph test was negative. Plus, the kid's never been sexually active.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I got that from the line in his chart that says "birthday clown."

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His late father was a circus clown.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Histoplasmosis?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not immuno-compromised. And I assume you added that irrelevant tidbit because you're moved by the son's idiotic tribute and think it justifies keeping your daughter in New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What if he has a heightened immune system?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I mentioned it becauseâ€¦

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take your time. We'll continue with the medicine.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Sjogren's could have given him chronic pericarditis and cerebral arteritis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sjogren's it is. IV immunosuppressants to treat. Anything?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This will calm your immune system. Should be out of here within the week.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: My mom will be happy to hear that. I've got an internship that starts in three weeks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I take it it's not at a place with a big top.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: It's at my stepdad's law office. I know I'm not any good at being a clown yet, but when I do get a laugh and see those kids' eyes light up, that's how my dad made me feel when I was a kid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You need to hang on to that.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Heh. My mom says he was a loving father but, always broke and, always on the road. It's a stupid way to make a living.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're 16. Plenty of time to make money. Wanting to build a connection with your dad and pass on some of the joy that he gave you, that's not stupid at all.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ooh. I got it.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Is, uh, is this because of the medication? Is it normal?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not normal, and it's not Sjogren's.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: T.I.A., thickened pericardium, and now he's bleeding from his nose and mouth.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What are you doing with her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Her"? Surely this bundle of fun has an actual name.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's Sophie.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Both your kids are namedâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's Sophie. The other one's Sophia. It different enough.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: They actually have two completely different derivations. No, they don't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I wasn't in a strong negotiating position. Why is she here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ruby dropped her off. Seemed pretty upset. Apparently someone forgot that it was daddy's night. She wasn't even gonna leave her until I said that I was letting you off early.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Damn it. I just started back on the team. My schedule's a mess.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If your own kids are a scheduling item, maybe you should let one of them move.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient has low platelets. Makes me think D.I.C.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She doesn't seem to like that idea. You're right. He has no schistocytes in his smear.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He also has a low red count. What if it's a retroperitoneal bleed?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No Grey-Turner's sign.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She wasn't fussing like that when I was holding her. Maybe she likes the sound of my voice, which is weird because I have no genetic connection to her. Could it be, she doesn't know the difference?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So many children of your own. No wonder you have such insight into my relationship with my babies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good point. How could I comprehend that you're too despised to keep them from having the same name, too overwhelmed to remember your own calendar, and too vain to admit that at this stage, you don't matter to either baby.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Low white count suggests infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if you're all right? Low platelets plus low red count plus low white count equalsâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Aplastic anemia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kid needs a bone marrow transplant. Everyone except Adams, transfuse his platelets till you find a match.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You started college a semester late because you left high school a semester late because you had five incompletes in your junior year.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And you're offering one bad semester as proof that my parents screwed me up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did okay before that. Straight As after that.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I went through a rebellious phase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't tell me. Mom and dad were at each other's throats and the academic crisis was a cry for help.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Sorry to mess with your worldview, but I'm not messed up, so my parents couldn't have messed me up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mom's HLA is only a 3/6 match.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maternal grandmother's worse than that. Where did you unload the baby?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Maternity ward. Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You realize you're making House's argument for him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The part where he said any parent who uses day care should ship their child across the country?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No, the part where he said that baby doesn't need you. You've only got her a couple days a week and most of that's spent with a rotating cast of nurses.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's how daddy likes to spend his time too.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: First cousin's also a whiff.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So much for genetics mattering. I'll try the marrow registry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Dr. Park is searching the registry. Transfusing his platelets will keep him healthy while we wait.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you sure there's no one on the father's side of the family? If one of them's a match, that'd speed things up a lot.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: His parents died young. He was an only child. There's no living relatives that I know of.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Something will turn up soon.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: How soon is soon? Will he miss a lot of school?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I'm actually thinking of just getting my GED.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: How do you expect to get into a good college?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I'm gonna take classes on magic and juggling and try to make a go of this.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: Ben, you keep your grades up, you can do anything in the world.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Like what? Work in some boring office? I mean, do you think my father would have done that for ten minutes?

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: You don't remember your father. You don't knowâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I want to build a connection with him, pass on some of theâ€¦ the joy that he gave me. My, uh, my back hurts. Uh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His BP is dropping.

utterance.speaker: Man on Phone
utterance.content: We think we've dealt wit all the liability issues.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm in a meeting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. Since you paged me, I didn't want to keep you waiting.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, I paged you, which means you're next.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's cool. I'll wait.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's a good start. Let's go through it point by point. First upâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll call you back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Just got this. The American Association of Rheumatology wants you to speak, 9:00, Saturday, in Atlantic City. Dr. Neusinger canceled on them at the last minute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hate conferences.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This is a big one, and it's the premium slot. I'd like you to do it. I'll clear it with your parole officer. What do I need to do for you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Halve the clinic hours that you recently doubled and double the hooker budget that you recently halved. I think you refer to it as petty cash.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fine. Just one thing. I'm gonna ask them to put you on in the morning. We're doing them a favor. Why should you have to spend the night?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You said that 9:00 was the premium slot. I mean, I want to feel like I've earned my hookers.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The place will be a madhouse, especially since it's two miles from the Rubio fight at the exact same time. Nice try. You called up, pretended to be Neusinger, cancelled, and suggested yourself as a replacement. You go to that fight, you go to prison.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But that'd be redundant, when I have an angry black guy waiting for me to drop the soap right here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Better go do some of those clinic hours I recently doubled.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Test my urine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like I was wrong about my diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Yeah. I have diabetes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, but you're not a hypochondriac or you would have imagined some new disease after I shot down the first one. So whose urine is that? Diabetic girlfriend without health insurance?

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: It's not a scam. I'm sick. Now I have swollen ankles.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The medical term is cankles. Is there some black market in insulin that I don't know about?

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: It's in my genes. My old man got diabetes at 50. My older brother, got it at 50. I just turned 50.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, it's a great argument if diabetes was a gold watch.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: I got sciatica, like my dad. Class-four hemorrhoids, like him. I need to get a jump on this thing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We had to stop the transfusion. Patient's having an allergic reaction to donor platelets.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No one in mom's family's a match, and as far as she knows, dad has no living relatives. It's been years since he died.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the kid's dad died young of melanoma, how come the overprotective mom never took him to a dermatologist?

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Are you gonna test my urine or what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not diabetes. Use cross-matched platelets. Try to find the patient some blood that's closer to his own. And get the real story on clown senior's death. Mom's hiding something. It's a good bet that it's medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apple juice. Easiest way to fake a spike in blood sugar.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His family history of melanoma may have affected his cellular outlook.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If we had more data on the exact type of melanoma his father hadâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Otherwise, we might not be able to find a marrow match.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: He never had melanoma.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How did he die?

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: He didn't. He lives in Pennsauken, under a different name, Mitchell Gordon.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: How could you keep this from me? From Ben?

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: He really needs to know his dad just breezed in and out of his life, drunk and incoherent? It's better to think the man's dead but decent.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You realize I have to invite someone else to the Rubio fight?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. No realization whatsoever.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have a LoJack on your leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was happy watching the fight on pay-per-view. You're the one who insisted we go to Atlantic City.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your biological father was a decent, God-fearing minister. The guy who raised you was a cold-hearted jerk. I'm trying to figure out why you're so convinced Adams has parentally inflicted damage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're trying to deflect.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Now you are. You have to believe that every parent screws up every child or you were screwed out of a decent childhood.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My decent daddy of the cloth was also being indecent with my married mom. He probably would have taken other kids to the playground.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not my fault. Bad parenting.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Mitchell Gordon?

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: I've already got a religion. Go away.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We're doctors. Your son Ben is in the hospital, at Princeton-Plainsboro. He's very sick.

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I don't have a son. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We know there are some issues there, but your bone marrow could cure him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There's a hospital two miles from here. It's a simple test.

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: You said he was at Princeton-Plainsboro?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His mother feels it's better to do the test at a different hospital.

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: Well, I guess I don't have a son anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House isn't gonna give up. Just tell him about your parents or make up a lie.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I don't want to lie. I don't want to validate his ridiculous theory.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not ridiculous. Even the best-intentioned parents end up damaging their kids.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're a smart, successful doctor. How much damage could you have?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You know how I got interested in medicine? When my mother drank, she couldn't handle me, so she locked me in my father's study. Only so many hours you can cry and bang on the door before you give up, find something to read. We all have family dysfunction. That's why we're successful. To fill that hole.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: My parents have a lot of money, but they didn't make it legally.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: White-collar crime?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It started with card games. High-stakes poker. Then my dad got into narcotics, at first just selling but then, using too, or he never would have gotten into the slave trade. Children mostly. Easier to pack in small crates. Plus the shipping's a lot cheaper.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Won't even trust a co-worker. What did your parents do to you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You have to go see him yourself. He wouldn't even come to the door a second time.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: Okay. I'll drive over there.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's a pleural effusion.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He had a bleeding problem earlier. Must be bleeding into his lungs.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Except there's no blood.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: What does it mean?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It means you don't have to make that drive. The problem isn't his marrow. It's his liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Liver failure. Explains everything. The question is, what explains the liver failure?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's not an infection. We tried antibiotics, but he's not responding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: More curiously, what explains the mom lying about dad pushing up squirting daisies?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This is how you plan to get to the boxing game?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why are you looking at her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause I'm stunned, and I have to look at something. Match, bout, fight, contest, day, Helena. Almost anything works after "boxing," except the word "game."

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Your bigger problem is the people who design those things aren't idiots.

utterance.speaker: Workman on the floor
utterance.content: Huh huh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you believe she used to work in the can? Nothing is tamper-proof.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's a synthetic problem. His liver's not synthesizing proteins, so fluid is leaking out of his blood vessels. And mom's a selfish jerk. She traded up, married a lawyer, wants to forget the lowly circus clown.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're defending the father because you feel like a jerk for baking buns in two different ovens. You want to believe the mythical biological connection excuses being a man slut. Ow! I don't know why I'm starting to doubt your expertise. You do have a classified ad and a piece of metal.

utterance.speaker: Workman
utterance.content: It's temperature that sets it off, not force. The rivets go pop, I slide in the heating pad. Easy peasy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: More likely the patient has a hyperammonemic problem. His liver's not cleaning out his blood. The buildup of toxins is causing everything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm defending the dad because he got screwed. After he lost his son, he lost his job. Been in and out of rehab, gave up clowning. Yes, as a parent, I empathize. I say we tell the kid.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's a minor, the mom's his guardian, and it's not even medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She robbed them of 12 years together.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or she ripped off the band-aid too late. That memory that she let son of Bozo establish is making him chase his father's moronic profession when he could be living the high life in Portland. And I mean that metaphorically, of course.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is where you dazzle me with your contingency plan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I see why employers are reluctant to hire ex-cons.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Well, what about the patient? Is the problem hyperammonemic or synthetic?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can't treat for both. One requires hemodialysis, the other a liver transplant, and we couldn't even get the kid a marrow match.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get the mom's consent to pump him full of protein. If it's a synthetic problem, more fluid will leak into his chest and his heart will fail. If it's hyperammonemic, toxins will overwhelm his body and he'll go into a coma.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Do you only like tests that involve the risk of death?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There are some slower, less conclusive tests, but why take that risk?

utterance.speaker: Man holding receiver
utterance.content: In here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God. The water. This is completely my fault.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are very serious risks, but if we don't figure out what he has, we can't treat him at all.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I may be a little out of bounds here, but in case there are complications, it might be a good time to come clean to your son, let his father visit.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: A little out of bounds?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't know the history, but everyone makes mistakes. Your son worships him.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: Doctor's right about that.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? And when did he learn that? When he encouraged Ben to drop out of school? Mitchell is not Ben's father any more than a sperm donor would have been.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless you're a locksmith or an electrician with political contacts. I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My condolences on your forthcoming divorce.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Since I have no intention of testing him, treating him, or cooking for himâ€¦

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The advantage of fake prescriptions is, you don't have to be a real doctor to write one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Imaginary medicine is not my specialty. I do have an imaginary colleague who's just sent me an imaginary page. Imagine how sorry I am.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Still mad about what happened in the lab?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm not mad. I'm being professional.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You claim you're not screwed up. You may even believe it. But House doesn't and I don't, so you can wait till he camps out on your parents' lawn or you can admit you don't live on some higher plane and thank me later.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: My, uh, my eye feels weird. What's happening to me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You look tired.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: I hate it when people say that. I know, I look bad.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I thought you were gonna go to bed early last night.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: Like an idiot, I went out with my girlfriends to pretend I have a life, when all I did was flirt with guys who'd have no interest in a mom, miss the baby I couldn't wait to get rid of, and then get yelled at by my mom for staying out too late.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You need your own place.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: Yes. I moved back home because it was too drafty at the Four Seasons.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So go back to work at the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: Day care costs more than what I earned as a nurse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Have you considered sub-standard day care? Why don't you stay here tonight? No. I mean, in the guest room. I'll watch the baby again, and you can get a real night's sleep.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: You'd do that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Win-win. Mommy gets a rest, Daddy gets more time with his little angel. Thereâ€™re some sweats in the closet in the back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lucky girl. Gets another sleepover with da-da. It makes a difference. Doesn't it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't answer your page last night.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry. Battery died.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We got the patient's eye back in place with steroid injections, but a bulging eyeball means it's not a liver problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And mom's determination to keep dad away, even as her kid gets sicker and sicker, means she's got more to hide.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not diagnostically relevant. Let's let it drop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You just lost my vote. You flip-flopped on parental rights.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've been trying to persuade the mother, but it's her son, so it's her call.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that very evolved of you. Don't usually see Darwinian changes over breakfast. You made nice-nice with Phil. You decided that he'd make a decent father for thing 2 after all.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I had Sophie again last night and Ruby slept in my guest room, which has nothing to do with Phil, who will never be a father to my children.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Angioneurotic edema can cause rapid swelling.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, we're having a conversation here. No abdominal pain. So that must have been nice, having Ruby and the baby under one roof.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, it was nice having my daughter in my home. That's why I would like her sister to live near my home.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Anasarca?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Swelling would have followed gravity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Isn't that getting this whole parenting thing ass backwards? Aren't you supposed to figure out what you can sacrifice to maximize their niceness?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And do you think I should sacrifice myself from their lives?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just one life, until the other one's mommy meets someone nicer than you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Swelling that fast and localized has to come from the lymph nodes. Burkitt's lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Swelling. Cankles.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's not a symptom of Burkitt's. Are you saying it'sâ€¦

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's Burkitt's. Prep him for chemo.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think you should give House permission to go to Atlantic City. We'll stop by the rheumatology conference. Everyone's covered.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The guy has earned the right to go to one boxing match. He's done everything you've askedâ€¦ Funded and staffed his own department. Hasn't even broken as much as a traffic law.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So, you'll let him go?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. I get why he wants to go to that fight. I'd love to go myself, which is kind of why I have to stop him. My job is to be the jerk. House has to believe that I have authority over him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He can't function under someone's thumb.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know, which means you can't go either. Your job is to be his friend, to stay here and sit with him and watch the fight on pay-per-view while bitching about me. If we both do our jobs, we might actually get him through his parole.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sorry to show up like this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was expecting a battery of lawyers.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No lawyers. Phil had something that he would like to say, so I thought that he should say it in person.

utterance.speaker: Phil
utterance.content: It was wrong of me to confront you about taking Rachel to Portland.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You don't want to move to Portland?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Of course I do, but this is about your daughter too and I'm not gonna do something like this without your support.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So you guys are trying to manipulate me by playing good cop/good cop?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is that how little you think of me? It's clear you're back working for House. I will see you this weekend when you pick up Sophie.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sophia.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We actually started calling her Sophie.

utterance.speaker: Phil
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Great. It's cute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cankles.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: I'm faint. I've been gaining more weight. I think I need a bigger dose.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you double his placebo, he might drown. Also, you forgot to mention that your heart rate is slow.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Myâ€¦ my heart rate is notâ€¦ 52?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The technical term is slow. Those awful anti-diabetic meals you eat, do they contain bok choy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bok choy has glucosinolates, which inhibit thyroid function and account for all your symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: So this isn't diabetes?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have a bad case of irony. The food that you're eating to stop making you sick is making you sick.

utterance.speaker: Monroe
utterance.content: Hey, maybe I don't have my father's crummy genes after all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On the other hand, maybe you're fat enough to get diabetes even without â€˜em.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I can't believe I have cancer.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We caught it early. You should be okay.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I could die. I never went anywhere, did anything. If my father had lived, everything would have been different.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your mom and stepdad love you. They've given you a great home. That counts for a lot.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's crashing. Everything's shutting down.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Renal failure, lung failure, heart failure, all before we started chemo.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Burkitt's lymphoma is fast-moving, but not this fast.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No rush. ICU stands for take your time, in Latin.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Multiple aneurysms?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would mean that every symptom after his T.I.A. was a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Cholesterol emboli?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bingo. Fits perfectly. Check the file, confirm that we did major abdominal surgery on him and then completely forgot about it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: I was told that this might be my last chance to see my son.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: You had no right! This is none of your business!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: I called him. This man's Ben's hero. Let them spend five minutes together.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: No! Get out of here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait. You sexually molested your son. Your walk, tabes dorsalis. You have late-stage syphilis, which you gave to our patient, presumably 12 years ago, which also explains why mom is not big on family reunions.

utterance.speaker: Mitchell
utterance.content: I shouldn't be here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We tested him for syphilis. He was negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: After 12 years, the active infection would have died down. Everywhere except the arteries in his brain, where it could hide out from our tests. But when that six-year-old heckler punched him in his juggling pins, it kicked up the dormant bacteria in his pelvis. The immunosuppressantâ€™s we gave him sent it into overdrive. The antibiotics we gave him actually started destroying the syphilis. But like pouring water on a fire, that led to a trail of toxic smoke and ash, which made his immune system overcompensate. Severe Jarisch-Herxheimer reaction.

utterance.speaker: Ron
utterance.content: Is this true?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, Jarisch-Herxheimer is real. It sounds silly, butâ€¦ Oh, you mean theâ€¦ theâ€¦ right.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: I found stains on his clothes. He didn't understand and he didn't seem traumatized. I kept trying to talk to him, but before long, he'd forgotten, and he seemedâ€¦ and he seemed happy and he seemed normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you made daddy go away and you made sure junior had no reason to go looking.

utterance.speaker: Janey
utterance.content: I was just trying to protect him, like I should have done from the start. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: IV penicillin and anti-TNF antibodies, he'll be fine. Apart from the whole daddy-rape thing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We're not done.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, we are not. Notify the dad's sexual partners. Notify his employer, his landlord. Notify the police.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I meant the kid. We're not gonna tell him he was molested?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To make him miserable or to forfeit your license?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: To tell him the truth. He's a virgin. How do we explain the STD? It's a medical diagnosis. Screw the parents. The kid's our patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I guess Taub's got a tough choice to make when the kid wakes up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why is it my choice?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause you're a dad. How could the rest of us possibly understand?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: What wasâ€¦ what was wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's called syphilis.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Uh, youâ€¦ you can get that without having sex?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't tell him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your heart said he needed to know. Your brain knew he's better off without it. Following your heart is easy. Following your brain is tough. Especially after years of following that much smaller third organ. That's why all parents screw up all children.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Evening.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Clever tactic, pretending you're not interested anymore.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How could that possibly work as a tactic? The fact is, once I saw those incompletes, I knew your parents screwed you up. The details are just gravy.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're wrong. The only evidence you have is proof of something else. I ran away from home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you had lousy parents.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Because I didn't. All my friends' parents were divorced or having affairs or barely knew their kids' birthdays.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You envied their dysfunction.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I-I thought it made them deeper somehow.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It was stupid. I hitchhiked to Manhattan, moved in with an older guy. In two months, I came running home. It took my parents years to get over it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's when you started to excel. You were making it up to them. Your parents screwed you up by not screwing you up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How does briefly wishing I was screwed up make me screwed up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's normal to be screwed up. It's really screwed up to romanticize it. I guess that's why you wanted to work with prisoners.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's why I wanted to work with you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a tactic.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chris.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah. I need to talk to you and Phil.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah. I can't let you move.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You drove all the way out here just to tell us what you already told us.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, open up. I don't want to miss the opening bell.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House?

utterance.speaker: Television Announcer
utterance.content: Telecast, we expect an electric atmosphere in the arena and a sellout crowd of about 10,000, for Rubio versus Santos, two great fighters with illustrious careers who might have been expected to meet a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: Television Announcer
utterance.content: As for Santos, his handlers tell us that he's done more roadwork than at any time in his career, hoping to prove tonight that he can box for 12 full rounds.

utterance.speaker: Television Announcer
utterance.content: Significant because Santos hasn't heard the final bell in more than six years.

utterance.speaker: Television Announcer
utterance.content: He comes in with straight knockout wins and we saw how a power puncher with a left hook was able to cut Rubio over the right eye in the tenth round of that last fight.
